result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman.  Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Projected Guilty Plea this date.  Defense requests additional time to prepare.  Court grants request.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman.  Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Status Conference held.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (21 pages) commencing 08-03-22 by KRISTIN MENZIA.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Level 5 supervision.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant in custody, not produced.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Defense requests adjourned status date as she is reviewing discovery.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail and Conditions of Release received and filed.  bm

Defendant Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman in court by video with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg who appears in person.  Defendant Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Marx. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.   Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court in person, defendant Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman not in court, in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Rosenberg to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Tanara N. C.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Taeshaun Isaiah Chapman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
